sentence.text: He was being shown round the Abbotsbury Swannery and was talking to swanherd John Fair near a swan and her cygnets when the swan took exception .
Recently I was shown around the offices of a community church that prides itself on its radical Christian commitment .

Boiling with rage , yet forced to keep a fixed smile on her face while Carole Meadows continued showing them around the small guest cottage , Laura could barely contain her fury .
George spent the next weeks showing Bob Lamb around the herds of sheep .
Once more , the manservant was there to show me into the drawing-room .
I was shown to the door . "
When they were shown to their table , Erica asked the sixty-four dollar question .
Ten minutes later the staff began to arrive and at nine o'clock Fred Workman walked in to introduce me to the staff and show me around the building .
When the Headmaster showed him around parts of Hardside he put little pieces of cloth down on the ground and stood on these to protect his shoes .
One of the officers showed me into the aeroplane and himself sat down in the pilot 's seat .

She was not like the Glasgow woman , who had shown him out into the street .

When Paula was shown into her office Arlene looked up from a sheaf of photographs which were spread on her desk with just a hint of impatience .
In the event I was shown into a small room with Her Majesty , where we sat together for some twenty minutes chatting amiably about almost anything under the sun .
Now , Mr . Holmes , with your permission , I will show you round the house . "
